msContents.summary: Composite manuscript containing fifteen stories in Judeo-Spanish written by various hands (folios 1a-88b; 97a-99b) and some Hebrew liturgical poems (‘piyyutim’) for different occasions (folios 89a-96b; 100a-114b).

msItem.title: Composite manuscript containing fifteen stories in Judeo-Spanish

foliation.p: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals at the top outer corner of side a of each folio. Unnumbered folio between folios 50 and 51, 2 folios numbered 65. Secondary foliation from folio 67: 1737-1739 (67-69), 1740-1756 (71-87), [..]58 (88), 1759 (97), [..] (98), 162 (99), etc.

condition.p: Repairs in inner edge with transparent tape. Folios have uneven edges.

bindingDesc.p: One quarter binding: brown leather spine and brown chequered paper boards. Remains of two paper lables on spine. English printed matter used as fourth front fly-leaf and back fly-leaf. The manuscript must have been bound or rebound incorrently given the misplacement of folios 97-99 that should follow folio 88 and folio 110 that should follow 107. In view of the catchwords several more parts seem to be in disorder, see especially folios 37-38, 45-46, 63-64, 75-76, 87-88, 100a-b, 101a-b, 107-108, 108-109.

physDesc.accMat: Note by N.Shalem on the content of the manuscript in Hebrew and English, written in London on 4 September 1938.

list.item: Front paste-down: Handwritten in pencil numeral 274 and several numbers and calculations.
Folio iia: Handwritten note reading "S.ra / Freja Brudo / Sn. Brudo Raffaell [...] 444".
Folio iib: Benj. Cohen .
Folio 1a: Handwritten in blue ink "No. 274 / M Gaster".
Owner's signature at the top edge of folios 3b, 4a, 6b: Salomon Bintata .
Folio 14a: Owner's signature on the outer edge, Benjamin Arye Haim Cohen .
Folio 29a: Owner's signature on the outer edge, Judah Go[..] .
Folio 75b: Ownership note reading "Questo di Josiph Olsa[...] / 1790".
Folio 88b: Handwritten note in blue ink reading "v. 8 fols. further on".
Folio 97a: Handwritten note in blue ink reading "v. 8 fols. [...]".
Folio 111b: Handwritten note possibly indicating a debt reading "Deve Sn Brudo Bentto Cohen Cohen".
Folio 114b: Moses Gaster's signature in blue ink and "114 f." in pencil.
Folio vb (back fly-leaf): Owner's signature, Mr Alexander Cohen [...] .

acquisition.p: Acquired by The John Rylands Library from the heirs of Moses Gaster Gaster, Moses 1856-1939 in 1954.

recordHist.source: Description based on Alexander Samely's unpublished draft catalogue and N. Shalem's note, revised and expanded by Stefania Silvestri and Renate Smithuis.

availability.p: The manuscript is available for consultation by any accredited reader.

msContents.summary: Jewish moral tales, on folios 1a-88b and 97a-99b.

msItem.title: מעשיות
Tales
msItem.note:
Each Judeo-Spanish story is preceded by the word ma‘aseh [מעשה], i.e. ‘story,’ in square script. These moral tales have been numbered in pencil in the manuscript and separately described in the accompanying note by N. Shalem. The stories are as follows:
Story 1 (1a-2b): Man deals with a thief.
Story 2 (2b-5b): Rabbi Meir saves Judah from the snake; on the importance of almsgiving. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 394, 151–52.
Story 3 (6a-8a): Rabbi Joshua ben Levi and the butcher who will be his companion in paradise; on the importance of charity. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 323, 117.
Story 4 (8a-14a) Rabbi Reuben ben Sabar and Matatiah ben Harash.
Story 5 (14a-18a) Rabbi Meir and the wife of Rabbi Judah the butcher. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 384, 147.
Story 6 (18a-20a) Pious man saves fellow Jews from persecution in a town in Ashkenaz.
Story 7 (20a-21a) The daughter of Rabbi Akiva is saved from a snake on her wedding day; on the importance of almsgiving. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 318, 116.
Story 8 (21b-24b) Diligent student recovers stolen money.
Story 9 (24b-27b) The weasel and the well; man does not keep his promise to marry a woman. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 89, 74.
Story 10 (27b-31a) Jewish woman enters the camp of the enemy to kill its general during the Babylonian conquest of Jerusalem (i.e. the story of Judith and Holofernes). Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 251, 106.
Story 11 (31a-34a) Nachum Ish Gamzu. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 25, 58.
Story 12 (34a-39b) Joshua ben Levi and the Angel of Death. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 138, 85.
Story 13 (39b-42a) Solomon and a poor man in the time of King David.
Story 14 (42a-44b) Nakdimon (Nicodemus) ben Gurion and the twelve water cisterns in Jerusalem. Cf. Gaster, Exempla, no. 85, 72.
Story 15 (45a-88b and 97a-99b) Joseph.

bibl.ref: Moses Gaster, The Exempla of the Rabbis Being a Collection of Exempla, Apologues and Tales Culled from Hebrew Manuscripts and Rare Hebrew Books (London; Leipzig, 1924)

p.catchwords: Catchwords at the bottom left corner of nearly each page.

handNote.desc: Sephardi square for the titles, different hands.

msContents.summary: Liturgical poems for the Havdalah, the ceremony for the end of Shabbat, on folios 89a-96b, for the rite of circumcision on folios 106a-111b, and for putting on phylacteries on folios 112-114b. Though most incipits have been transcribed, the survey below is as yet incomplete.

msItem.title: Liturgical poems and songs for the end of Shabbat
פיוטים וזמירות למוצאי שבת

list.item: Liturgical poem 1 (89a-b). Incipit: שבוע טוב בא לקראתכם תתחדש בו ימי שמחתכם. Acrostic poem forming the name Isaac [יצחק]. Cf. ש 411.
Liturgical poem 2 (89b-90a). Incipit: אלי אליה יבא אלינו יהיה אב רחמן זה שבועינו. Acrostic poem forming the name Abraham Hazzak? [אברהם ?חזק].
Liturgical poem 3 (90a-b). Incipit: מלכי וצורי שלח אל עמך הבא אליהו הנביא אליהו התשבי.

Liturgical poem 4 (90b-91a). Incipit: אלי אליה הנביא הבא נא אלי אליה משיח ה[...]ה בו ירתום רכבו. Acrostic poem forming the name Abraham [אברהם] (= Ibn Ezra, Abraham ben Meïr, 1089-1164 אבן עזרא, אברהם בן מאיר, 1089-1164 Ibn Ezra ). Cf. א 4916.
Liturgical poem 5 (91a-92a). Incipit: איש אשר קנא לשם האל איש בושר שלום. Alphabetical acrostic poem, preceded by a few opening words: זכרו לטוב בסימן טוב אליהו הנביא וכו. Cf. א 3121.
Liturgical poem 6 (92a). Incipit: אשרהו אשרי מי שראה פניו אפילו בחלום.

bibl.ref: Israel Davidson, Thesaurus of mediaeval Hebrew poetry (New York, 1924-1933)

msItem.title: Liturgical poems for the rite of circumcision
פיוטים של מילה

list.item: Liturgical poem 1 (106a). Incipit: יעקב בחר לו יה ישראל לסגולתו קראם מנת חלקו וחבל נחלתו. Acrostic poem forming the name Jacob ben Tsur [יעקב בן צור] (= Ibn Ẓur, Jacob ben Reuben 1673-1752 אבן צור, יעקב בן ראובן, 1673-1754 Jacob ben Tsur ). Cf. י 3258.
Liturgical poem 2 (106a-107a). Incipit: אל אדון ברצותו לטהרינו מסיג הערלה כי היא חרפה לנו . Acrostic poem forming forming the phrase “I, Moshe Hazzak [אני משה חזק].
Liturgical poem 3 (107a-b). Incipit: אפצחה בשירה בשמחה ובגילה לאל גדול נורא.

Liturgical poem 4 (107b). Incipit: מדם בשרי ארום תרומה אל יה תהלל כל הנשמה. Acrostic poem forming the name Moshe Zakut [משה זכות] (= Zacuto, Moses ben Mordecai, approximately 1620-1697 זכות, משה בן מרדכי, 1620?-1697 Moshe Zakut ). Cf. מ 260.

Liturgical poem 6 (108a-b). Incipit: אערוך זמר תוך מקהילות. This is poem is preceded by the end of another poem (starting from רץ במצות אל) of which the incipit is unknown, because the folios are no longer in the correct order.

Liturgical poem 7 (108b). Incipit: חותמך שדי חתמת בנו ישתבח שימך לעד מלכנו. Acrostic poem forming the name Jacob [יעקב] (= Ibn Ẓur, Jacob ben Reuben 1673-1752 אבן צור, יעקב בן ראובן, 1673-1754 Jacob ben Tsur ). Cf. ח 161.

Liturgical poem 9 (109a-b). Incipit: אערוך שיר תהילה לצור אשר אין בלתה. Acrostic poem forming the phrase “I, David Hazzak” [אני דוד חזק] (= David ben Aaron ibn Ḥassin, approximately 1730-1792 חסין, דוד בן אהרן אבן, 1727-1792 David ben Aaron ibn Hassin ). Cf. 7080 א. This poem is preceded by the end of another poem (starting from יום השמיני נבחר למולה) of which the incipit is unknown, because the folios are no longer in the correct order.
Liturgical poem 10 (109b). Incipit: עליון אהבת עולם אהבתנו. Uncertain whether the poem is complete due to the fact that the folios are no longer in the correct order.
Liturgical poem 11 (110a). Incipit: עלינו לשבח להדר ולנצח. Preceded by the note: עמנואל ?סי.
Liturgical poem 12 (110a-b). Incipit: שרידים נקראים עם סגולה קבלו עליהם המצות המילה. Acrostic poem forming the word Shaddai [שדי]. Cf. 2191 ש.
Liturgical poem 13 (110b). Incipit: אפצחה ברינה בגילה על מצות המילה.
Liturgical poem 14 (110b). Incipit: אמרו בחיבת עדת אמוני ברוך הבא בשם ה. It is unclear whether the manuscript contains the rest of the poem, because the folios are no longer in the correct order.
Liturgical poem 15 (111a). Incipit: קומי נא אל נורא. This folio might originally have followed folio 108 in view of the catchword קומי on 108b.
Liturgical poem 16 (111a). Incipit: ציץ פרח בגנינו יברכנו אלהינו לתורתך תזכהו. Cf. צ 326.

bibl.ref: Israel Davidson, Thesaurus of mediaeval Hebrew poetry (New York, 1924-1933)

msItem.title: Liturgical poems for putting on phylacteries
פיוטים של תפילין בע"ה

list.item: Liturgical poem 1 (112a). Incipit: עם הקדוש [...] אדיר שוכן שמי?ם.
Liturgical poem 2 (112a-b). Incipit: יתרומם שם אלהינו יתברך לעד סלה.
Liturgical poem 3 (112b-113a). Incipit: אשירה בקול זמרה בשיר ומצלתים מצות ה' ברה מאירת עיניים. Acrostic poem forming the name Jacob [יעקב]. Cf. א 7996.
Liturgical poem 4 (113a). Incipit: אל גדול נורא נאזר בגבורה ברוב תפארת הוא עיטרנו. Acrostic poem forming the words ‘I, Jacob Hazzak [אני יעקב חזק]. Cf. א 3536.
Liturgical poem 5 (113a-b). Incipit: עמוד נא פטרה חמודה בסוד ישרים ועדה.
Liturgical poem 6 (113b). Incipit: תמה בתריג מצות התורה. Followed by a liturgical note: מה דין לעמך. For the latter poem cf. ד 312.
Liturgical poem 7 (113b-114a). Incipit: נעים ונחמד קום לפני עדה טהורה.
Liturgical poem 8 (114a). Incipit: אערוך שיר הילולים ברוב עם במקבלים.
Liturgical poem 9 (114a-b). Incipit: קול רינה וישועה תתן ?ליוצריך. The poem is preceded by an introductory note.

bibl.ref: Israel Davidson, Thesaurus of mediaeval Hebrew poetry (New York, 1924-1933)
